title: Meddler, few months ago you said that you (Riot) are going to shift Rek'Sai's power.

embed.description: From Patchnotes 6.18: When Rek’Sai was released, we positioned her as a member of the Fighter class: a durable, damage-focused melee champion that wants to hunt down prey and finish it off herself. In the months following release, however, our balance work on Rek’Sai de-emphasized he

body: So what about her? When do you plan to change Rek'Sai from Tank to Warrior? And give her more advantages from building damage items than building tanky items.

replies.body: Rek'sai's kit will never allow her to be anything other than a tank for as long as she has the ability to teleport to any tunnel on the map, knock-up initiate & have sonar sense. The mechanics of her kit will need to change if they want to shift her identity, which basically calls for a gameplay rework. If Rek'sai can suddenly deal enough damage to kill carries with her current kit she will be back at being 100% pick/ban once again.
Diver like VI or Irelia, maybe?
{{champion:4}} {{champion:163}} They have ability to travel across like half the map, TF can stun, Taliyah can knock up and TF grants global vision on Ult. You say this is the fault, ok.

What can I tell about Rek'Sai which can stun (knock up) only when borrowed and needs to come to melee range. Most of her abilities are focused on damage (unborrowed E, both Q's, R passive), but they still build her tank.

It would be easier if I'd talk with same person as you probably didn't read my previous comment.

They could make her sonar more sonar like, say rings that expand out from rek'sai highlighting movement (harder to utilise and the waves could scale with either AD or levels) and the burrow Q could mark targets for bonus unburrow/E damage scaling with AD.

Better yet, make her sonar cost fury and increase her fury bar (half way empowers her E)

Then, lower base damage, buff scaling, buff innate beef just a little bit.

This would heavily encourage AD items.

But at the beggining (pre-cinderhulk) Rek'Sai was played more like Warrior than Tank/Vanguard. And Meddler said that they want to change "unhealthy" Rek'Sai tank to more offensive and "healthy" Rek'Sai warrior which could be less tanky and more focused on dealing dmg.
Easier said then done.
